comments:
Mylar does not seem to correctly support the SOAP API of JIRA 3.3.1. Related report: http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/JDB-121 .

[..]
Caused by: org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.ServiceUnavailableException: argument type mismatch
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.soap.SoapJiraService.getProjects(SoapJiraService.java:232)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.initializeProjects(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:227)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.getProjects(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:266)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.wizards.JiraProjectPage$5.run(JiraProjectPage.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
Steffen: do you plan on looking into this?
I was thinking about posting to the news group to gather some data on this but maybe it's better to just install 3.4.1 and see if that works once we get the license key from Atlassian.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 172394 ***
